text: 124.1. Decode Directories (Inode to Name) The following is the hexdump of a directory that uses the following structure for its dirents. struct dirent { ino_t d_ino; // 32 bits _uintl6_t d_reclen; __uint8_t d_type; __uint8_t d_namlen; char d_name[255+1]; I #define DT_DIR 4 #define DT_REG 8 #define DT_LNK 10 What is the name of the object with inode number 0x100002? You may find it convenient to refer to an online hex to string converter, such as: https://onlinestringtools.com/convert-hexadecimal-to-string. 0000000 00 00 10 00 Oc 00 04 01 2e 00 00 00 01 00 10 00 0000010 Oc 00 04 02 2e 2e 00 00 64 00 00 00 10 00 08 05 0000020 41 70 68 69 64 00 00 00 65 00 00 00 10 00 Qa 05 0000030 48 6T 72 73 65 00 00 00 66 00 00 00 10 00 08 05 0000040 53 6e 61 69 6c 00 00 00 02 00 10 00 14 00 04 @b 0000050 53 70 65 72 6d 20 77 68 61 6c 65 00 00 00 00 00 0000060 10 00 08 06 50 69 67 65 6f 6e 00 68 67 00 00 00 0000070 10 00 08 06 50 69 67 65 6f 6e 00 68 000007c (2] Save & Grade Single attempt Additional attempts available with new variants @
